text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Hyper Neo-Geo 64 is a JAMMA-compatible arcade machine cartridge video game system, intended for arcades and released by SNK in September 1997. Technically, as its name suggests, the Hyper Neo -Geo 64 has a 64-bit microprocessor to run 3D games. The Hyper Neo-Geo 64 was a commercial failure, mainly due to competition from Sega and its more technically advanced Model 2 arcade system with more attractive games. In total, only seven games were released on Hyper NeoGeo 64.
